intro: Dychotria, commonly known as the twinleaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive leaf structure, with leaves divided into two symmetrical lobes. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of the carrot family. Dychotria species are typically found in temperate regions and thrive in moist, well-drained soils. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value and have a mild, aromatic scent.
